sentences: Yuri Sergeevich Sakhnovsky (Russian: Ю́рий Серге́евич Сахно́вский) (1866–1930) was a Russian composer, conductor and music critic.
While a student Sakhnovsky took in his eight-year younger fellow student Rachmaninoff during the difficult winter when it seemed he was suffering from malaria.
Particularly notorious were his attacks on Alexander Scriabin's music as "decadent" from 1911-1914.
